results.description: Core: buy stocks where est_eps is increasing vs 1 quarter ago. Applied SUGGESTION1 by using est_eps (high userCount). SUGGESTION2: no explicit vector fields found so vec_avg not used. SUGGESTION3: est_eps coverage>0.6 so ts_backfill not required. SUGGESTION4: chose high userCount field for signal robustness. Kept KEEP_IN_MIND: implementation short, uses 1 datafield and 1 operator. Confidence set to 0.7 because analyst estimate momentum historically predictive but noisy.

results.idea: Earnings estimate surprise vs previous estimate
results.description: Core: long when est_eps > eps_previous_estimate_value (upward revisions). S1: uses two datafields. S2: no vector fields. S3: both fields high coverage so no backfill. S4: both have many users. KEEP_IN_MIND obeyed (<=2 datafields, brief ops). Confidence 0.72 due to strong signal from upward revisions.

Core: rank recent est_eps change within stock's recent history using ts_zscore. S1: single datafield. S2: no vector. S3: coverage ok. S4: high userCount used. KEEP_IN_MIND: short. Confidence 0.68 — zscore reduces outliers.

Core: cross-sectional quantile of recent est_eps returns to pick relative winners. S1: uses ts_returns then quantile. S2: no vector. S3: est_eps coverage ok. S4: high userCount. KEEP_IN_MIND adhered. Confidence 0.66 since cross-sectional normalization helps.

Core: use anl4_basicconqfv110_numest (number of forecasts) growth to capture increased analyst attention. S1: single datafield. S2: not vector. S3: coverage ~0.7262 (>0.6) so no backfill. S4: userCount moderate. KEEP_IN_MIND short. Confidence 0.55 - moderate predictive value.

Core: combine increase in number of upward estimates with increase in est_eps: ts_delta(est_eps,4) * ts_delta(anl4_basicconqfv110_pu,4). S1: uses two fields. S2: no vector. S3: both coverages >0.6 so no backfill. S4: both have many users. KEEP_IN_MIND: 2 datafields, 3 operators. Confidence 0.7 — combining magnitude and breadth of revisions.

Core: long where earnings_per_share_standard_deviation falls (consensus tightens) while est_eps rises. S1: uses two fields. S2: vector not present. S3: stddev coverage ~0.7237 so OK. S4: userCount small but acceptable. KEEP_IN_MIND short. Confidence 0.62 — tighter consensus often precedes positive surprises.

Core: use anl4_mark (recommendation consensus score) rising trend as signal. S1: single high-user field. S2: not vector. S3: coverage ~0.6243 borderline but >0.6 so no backfill. S4: good userCount. KEEP_IN_MIND short. Confidence 0.6 — consensus upgrades useful but noisy.

Core: difference between actual reported earnings (anl4_af_eps_value) and prior est_eps: subtract(anl4_af_eps_value, est_eps). S1: two fields used. S2: no vector.
